page.title: 15Language 2
page.content:
Birds, plants, insects. hanser - heron ranny - shrew mouse dicky - donkey dodiman - snail bishe-barnabee - ladybird pishimere - ant
Other words. Plancher - floor, duste - floor cloth, mardle - to gossip, bore - person, mauther - girl, hull - to throw, cop - to throw underarm, shiver - splinter, all of a huh - awry.
The habit of changing "U" into "W" at the beginning of a word is very common. The vowel sound "O" is pronounced "OO" ("go" becomes "goo"), "bones" becomes "boones", this is distinctive to Norfolk.
